page.title: 05Distant View-Tamar Valley.
page.content: Looking from the A390 towards Plymouth, fields are laid out in a patchwork of colours, browns, yellows and predominant greens, where sheep and cattle graze. On a clear day the bridges, linking Devon and Cornwall, carrying cars and trains, can be clearly seen. Behind the bridges the huge cranes of Plymouth Dockyard tower over the river. Beyond that, is Plymouth City with its blocks of flats spread out in front of Plymouth Sound. Away to the East, Dartmoor can be seen with its dark shadow spread out along the horizon. Small woods shelter scattered villages and farms. Wooded hedges snake over the hills. By night the twinkling lights of Plymouth are reflected in the river as the Eddystone Light flashes its warning and Dartmoor disappears into the shadows.
